climbs.name: Too Tall for Twomey
climbs.fa: Equipped/Cleaned: Johnny Crider FA: T Spiegelberg

content.description: KILLER!!! Johnny's first route at The Shipyard is a dandy! Summon your inner MJ and jump to a giant edge to begin the route. Heel hook and bump up to establish yourself on the wall and continue climbing awesome jugs. Beware of the sting in the tail finish! An instant classic! Mandatory stick clip.
content.location: Currently the furthest left route on the Mytho wall. Look for the jump start above the lock box.

content.description:
A great line that starts on the best crimping at the Shipyard and finishes on a technical crux up high with a decent boulder problem. The position on the streak is incredible. Enjoy!

For our best friend, Tanner Schoonmaker. Climb forever Kevin!
content.protection: 8ish wave bolts to rings. Stick clip the first?

content.description:
This seemingly endless line is an endurance test piece. This shining white panel of dead vertical dolomite continues to test you all the way to the anchors. Expect easier movement low, and continuous hard sequences throughout the upper half on in-cut crimps, sidepulls and small pockets.

A 60M ROPE WILL NOT GET YOU DOWN.
content.protection: 13 glue in's to clip and lower anchors (installed 2016)
content.location: On the far right side of the Mytho Wall. Just left of the large corner system.

climbs.name: Siren
climbs.fa: Equipped- Terry Twomey FA- Taylor Spiegelberg 9/23/18

content.description:
Siren climbs a high-quality red streak of dolomite just left of the two blue streaks. This pitch is rather short, but features super fun, gymnastic movement off of beautifully sculpted holds. Expect a thin low crux, and a dynamic crux a little higher. It seems this line has been overlooked due to its proximity to the blue streaks, but the quality of movement is just as good!

This beautiful climb was another route developed by the late Terry Twomey. He had an eye for great lines, and it really shows in this route. Terry left some bolts heading up to the rim above the Siren anchors. As of recently, these don't go anywhere, but could be developed into a cherry mega pitch similar to Leviathan.

This route is a slight switch from the classic nature of climbing on this wall. Start on small pockets and crimps until you gain a big jug, then move right and up. Crimping, twisting, and technical body english lead you to a high crux.
content.location: Left of Siren, look for the glue in bolts. Starts off a boulder

climbs.name: Sea Sprite
climbs.fa: Bolted by Terry Twomey, FA Alli Rainey

content.description: Good holds and super cool movement on classic dolomite. Start on good pockets with bad feet, continue on interesting moves through good holds. Crux comes at 2/3rds height on positive crimps with a fun move into a small dihedral. Get after it, this ones fun!
content.location: On the south facing wall below the Bermuda Triangle Wall. Early morning/evening shade

content.description:
Monos monos monos! Climb Shipyard style jugs for 60 ft with a few hard crimps thrown in for good measure. Rest, then quest up bouldery, fun moves through some very committing mono pulls. Lizard Baby ends at the break with clip and lower anchors.

Top bulge is the Lizard Queen project. After relaxing at the jug, cross high then boulder up and right. The crux comes when you throw at two half pad crimps. Quest up crosely rock to the finish. A beautiful, long line.

The first 7 bolts of this climb is a great 5.10 warmup for the area.
content.protection: 10-12 wave bolts to clip and lower anchors
content.location: Right of Tanners Perpetual Motion Machine. Starts on a giant flake.

climbs.name: Little Nemo
climbs.fa: Equipped by the late Terry Twomey

content.description: Little Nemo (named after the orange fish) climbs up the pocket band on a beautiful hunk of rock. Expect a cruxy start to long pulls on good holds. After pulling through a small overhang, hold on until the kick in the tail finish.
content.location: Left Center, Mytho Wall. Look for a rounded roof where you move up and left.

content.description: The crux of this route is right off the ground. The first 4 bolts consists of really fun, crimpy/bouldery, 5.11b climbing. After that, you go into monster ledges/holds for 4 bolts and then to some unique chert features! It can get a little pumpy up top, so utilize the rests.  If you're not a strong 11 climber you may want to stick clip the 1st or 2nd bolt.
content.protection: 12 bolts to sport anchors. Remember to only clip and lower...top rope on your draws, please!
content.location: This route is just to the right (5 feet) of the Floch Ness Monster.

content.description:
Dedicated to our friend and the man who envisioned/named this route, Terry Twomey (PINEY POP!).

Words can't describe what it feels like to awaken THE KRAKEN... Staring up at the beauty of this blue streak will transport you to the cliffs of Ceuse. She's not only pretty, but climbs amazingly well. Prepare for movement involving long dynamic pulls between sinker pockets and distinct rests after boulder problems. The flow stone provides quite a few options, but choosing correctly is key. Watch out sportos, the finish is tricky...

Be careful climbing this after rain or in the spring as it is a common rockfall zone. Don't hang out on the low trail right under the "chute". It also may need yearly brushing/pocket cleaning as the streak stays wet much of the spring.

Good pockets and box crimps lead up the center of the Mytho Wall. Crux is toward the end and involves crazy pockets that don't face the way you want them to. Pumpy fun climbing that is a good warm up for this area. When lowering your partner, clip into the bolt low on wall so you don't fly out into space!
content.protection: 7 bolts to clip and lower anchors.
content.location: Behind the big tree on the Mytho wall. Brown hangers.

content.description: Classic Shipyard pockets with an outstanding finish. Hera has become the most popular 5.11 in Piney Creek, and for good reason. The route has several cruxes, but is very accessible due to the large holds.
content.protection: Wave Bolts to steel lower off
content.location: Mythos Wall in between Leviathan and Sea Sprite. Look for the flake start, slightly overhung the whole way with a bulge roof finish.

content.description: In between Sea Sprite and Hydra, this temptress starts out with a committing move off the large flake and proceeds up the bolt line. If you're able to tame the crux and land on those juicy jug lines, traverse left and up to the finish.
content.protection: Bolts to steel clip and lowers
content.location: Right of Sea Sprite, Left of Hydra

content.description:
The technical crux is at the start of the route, in between the 1st bolt and the 2nd bolt.  It's a bouldery start, but goes into great hands for clipping the 2nd bolt. If you're not super comfortable with climbing 11's you might want to clip the 2nd bolt.

The second crux is an endurance crux (this route is roughly 28 meters tall). After you pull the first crux use your rest spots wisely; you will find yourself getting pumped throughout the rest of the route, which is sustained 5.10d fun!
content.protection:
You will need 14 draws, plus two draws for the anchors.

**Note, there is one permadraw on this route to help with cleaning the route. Clip into the permadraw when you're being lowered, otherwise it can be a real bearcat to clean the route.
content.location: This route is one of the first routes you will see when walking up to the Shipyard. There are two very nice belay ledges below the route (Man made by stacking logs), which you will walk right next to/on when going up to the main area. The Flacness Monster is located in the dihedral.
